author: Danielle Berjikian
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

While no country is perfect, there’s a reason it’s nearly impossible to “stand against America.” And while woke author Elie Mystal thinks the U.S. deserves a stern finger-pointing from many of the countries that rely on it for foreign aid—including military assistance—someone should probably let him know why that’s never going to happen.

Tell me you hate America without saying it. Elie Mystal: Say less.

Elie Mystal: "Our country is THE bad guy on the world stage. The world needs to stand against America. Sanction us." pic.twitter.com/3OjPx52Ryn
— End Wo
title: MSNBC's favorite legal "expert" demands other countries start to sanction America because of how much he hates our country

author: Brodigan
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

As it would turn out, The Zohran has quite the digital paper trail where he says out loud what his plans are. Such as the "not" communist plan to convert private property into communes. Yes, in New York City. I know that you know how that will turn out. But a trust fund baby who went to an expensive private school that claims he's from the third world does not.

To be clear, this is NOT a communist idea. Independent fact-checkers claim so. Even though he supports communist ideals and wants to seize the means of production -- which The Zohran has said out loud with his words that came out of his mouth -- he says he's not a communist and is only a socialist. I'm gue
title: Zohran Mamdani's latest "don't call it Communist" scam is to covert NYC real estate into communes

author: Brodigan
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

It is 7:48 a.m. as I write this. By the time you read this, the Big Beautiful Bill may have been passed. Yay! Go Team!

However, as of this writing, there was drama over a vote to open debate (we voted to vote), and the usual journalisming about how "unpopular" the BBB is and how it's dividing the party. Leave it to Scott Jennings to cut through the BBBBulsh*t about the bill in a message all on the fence Republicans need to get behind.

To be clear, there is no doubt that before the bill is passed, or even just after, a poll will be conducted by a media outlet labeling the BBB the most unpopular piece of legislation ever and stating that any R who votes for it
title: Scott Jennings explains it slowly to GOP holdouts afraid of the allegedly "unpopular" Big Beautiful Bill
